text: My initial "off the top of my head" kumena deck
I keep seeing the "kumena can't be blocked" ability and want to find a way to balance the tribal part and making it a beater deck too
Too tempting to durdle the table to death.
That many dudes you should be running Lurking Predators
[[lurking predators]]

attachments.fallback: Lurking Predators {4}{G}{G} // Enchantment // Whenever an opponent casts a spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put that card on the bottom of your library.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put that card on the bottom of your library.
_All are prey to the eyes of the wild._
attachments.title: Lurking Predators {4}{G}{G}

text: True. It was that or descendants path
[[descendants path]]

attachments.fallback: Descendants' Path {2}{G} // Enchantment // At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.

text: I'd much rather have Brainstorm than Ponder or Preordain myself
I'm not running any shuffle effects. I hate brainstorm w/o being able to shuffle
Brainstorm in edh is super overrated
Nah, it's just there's a lot more people bad at it. I see the point about no shuffle in this deck though.
There are indeed a large amount of people that are bad at brainstorming
You don't even realize how bad you are at it until you learn how to be even ok at it

text: I just compared Chart a Course to Brainstorm on the podcast. It's a pretty rudamentary comparison because there's a lot more tricks with Brainstorm, but Chart allows smart players to be smart players in a dime-store Brainstorm way
Chart a Course is my favorite "vanilla" card this year.
It's "just" a draw spell, but it's such a fucking good one.
I haven’t played with it yet. Considered it for Mimeo because I like the discard. Is it really all that? It looks underwhelming to me still...
It's as good as ponder / preordain / brainstorm
As good as brainstorm is taking it a bit far.
Being able to not discard if you're greedy, or discard if you want to get that Elesh Norn in the yard to reanimate or whatever is really useful if you're someone paying attention to such things
It is. I don't think it will be banned from modern or anything
But it's an apt comparison
That sounds a little preposterous... not that I think it’s necessarily bad, but it looks more to me like divination than ponder
I’d like to be wrong about that though. Like I said, the discard is nice for my reanimating decks, which is basically all of them
It's to Brainstorm-type spells what Cryptolith Rites is to Earthcraft
I mean, it doesn't cost one, so it's not strictly in the same tier
Divination is a bad, near unplayable card
But I'd call it an instant format staple
Nor is it an instant, another big notch against a brainstorm comparison
I'd say it's closer to ponder/opt
Brainstorm comes from a lost time of magic where spells were too efficient and creatures sucked.
I’ll try it out. I think I’m right to be a little dubious about it, is all
It’s the most efficient new draw spell Blue will likely see in modern magic.
I'm overemphasizing it a bit. It's not quite as good as Brainstorm.

In certain decks I think it's going to be very powerful, but I'm with Joey I don't think it will be as ubiquitous as ponder or some others. I think it'll be better than serum visions tier cantrips for edh. Depending on the deck I'd say it's in the preordain level. More for some decks though
I think recency bias is in play with it a bit
I'd almost always run it over Ponder
I'm not sure about over Ponder, but definitely in that package
Dana, do you like it better than Night's Whisper?
<@U4V5EHQ2G> loves night's whisper
I know he does.
I think he might like this better because of the added flexibility.
Depends on the deck vs Nights Whisper bit I do love that card
Where would you run whisper over it?
If the raid trigger is harder in your deck I’d take Whisper
Low creature count etc
I should say if the raid trigger is harder and you don’t have recursion
Any examples from your own decks?
I don’t think it consider it in Isperia. 18 bodies and zero recursion
Though it still would be fine
If that deck was Sharuum or something with black and the same creature count I’d run Whisper over it for sure
I will admit though I’m very reckless with my life total
Good to know for future reference
Nights whisper and painful truths have really impressed me in nonblue decks. Edgar especially
The last time I cast painful truths was against a grand arbiter deck with a Thalia out, and I had mana confluence and a birds of paradise.
Completely a magical Christmas land scenario, but i lived it.
This was in my thrasios/ravos deck, which I immediately took apart after.
I don't love Painful Truths. Yeah, that kind of thing happens once in 1000 games, but there's too many times it's a bad Read the Bones
Yup
If you're not playing 3 colors it's probably wrong
If you’re not playing 3 colors it’s super wrong
It's probably still wrong in 3 colors
Paying 3 and 3 life to draw 3 cards is a fine rate.
The card is chancy.
You need to have and use all three colors to get those cards.
I'd rather run Read the Bones.
Even in three if you're not running a perfect mana base there's gonna be too many times you can't spare all three without preventing you from casting something else.
Exactly
I never said run it over Read the Bones
It sits between those and things like [[Ambition's Cost]]

attachments.fallback: Ambition's Cost {3}{B} // Sorcery // You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
_"Conquering your first world is the hardest, after all. My power grew as I moved from world to world, taking anything that would make the next taking easier." —Ob Nixilis_
attachments.title: Ambition's Cost {3}{B}

it actually reminds me a lot of my no turns deck from earlier this year on the podcast
a lot of the same themes, just went about it in a more sensible way
Thanks man!
I'm not sure blazing archon is going to be super castable though in this deck
Yeah I'm hoping it ends up testing well, but I'm running enough pillowfort that it may not be necessary.
